headerText: The `v-bottom-navigation` is an alternative to the sidebar. It is primarily used on mobile and comes in two variants, icons and text, and shift.

usage.desc: While the bottom nav is meant to be used with the `vue-router`, you can also programmatically control the active state of the buttons by using the `active.sync` prop. You can change a button's value by using its `value` attribute.

color.desc: The `color` prop applys a color to the background the bottom navigation. It is recommended to use the `light` and `dark` props to properly contrast text color.

grow.desc: If `v-bottom-navigation` has `grow` property, buttons within it grow to fill available space.

horizontal.desc: The `horizontal` prop, places nav text next to the icon as appose to beneath it.

shift.desc: The `shift` prop will hide the button text until active. For this to work, `v-btn` text is required to be wrapped in a `<span>` tag.

toggle.desc: As with other Vuetify components, you can control the display state with `v-model`.

hide-on-scroll.desc: Hide-on-scroll hides `v-bottom-navigation` when target element is scrolled.

scroll-threshold.desc: `scroll-threshold` property allows you to customize the threshold you can scroll before `v-bottom-navigation` disappears.

props.grow: Force `v-btn`s to take up all available space
props.hideOnScroll: Will transition the navigation off screen when scrolling up
props.horizontal: Uses an alternative horizontal styling for `v-btn`
props.inputValue: Holds the value of the currently active button. If the button has no value supplied, its index will be used instead. This prop supports the **.sync** modifier.
